intro: Leonohebe subsimilis var. astonii, commonly known as the Stewart Island hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in coastal and moist forest environments, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
